reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Novotel Rotorua is a good place to stay! is clean,beautiful and you can walk around safely! the staff is very friendly!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: Clean and convenient with helpful staff- one of our party asked for a hot water bottle and it was instantly produced. It was only a short walk to the town. There was a craft market one evening during our stay. The guest laundry was very useful.
reviews.title: Friendly Service
Novotel Rotorua
reviews.text: We had a great time at this hotel by the lake in Rotorua. The service was so friendly that we felt as though we were staying with friends rather than in a hotel. As good as any that we have experienced anywhere in the world! They must have great staff training, everyone greeted us as we passed by, from the bar staff to the cleaners. The bar had happy hour, the restaurant meal was really nice and well presented, the bed was comfy and the mineral hot pools were lovely. What more could we want!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights from February 6 2012 in a suite, room 301. The room was nice, clean and everything worked. There is a guest laundry on level 1, $2.00 per load including detergent, the drier was $2.00 also. We had a good view of the lake and there was no outside noise.
reviews.title: Hard to fault, close to everything and very clean

reviews.text: We used the private thermal pools which were nice but not as good as the Polynesian Spa private pools (but were less than half the price ). The other pools and spa were also very good.
reviews.title: Great location, but noisy room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The also used both the bar and restaurant and found the food good and the price was ok as well. The bar is very nice and the service was excellent. I found all the staff to be very helpful regardless of my questions. You could tell this is a hotel used to dealing with tourists.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed one night in Novotel Rotorua whilst travelling the North Island.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well placed, near the lakeside with lovely views across the water, within easy walking distance of the town centre and some very good places to eat and also close to the lovely Government Gardens and excellent Museum. We were very well looked after by the staff, with one of the reception staff lending us her personal umbrella when we went out in a shower and another cancelling the cost of the packet of crisps we'd had from the mini-bar in our room because we said the crisps tasted horrible (which they did, we liked the way he accepted our view without question). The room was spacious and very well specified. I found it a little irritating that internet in the room is charged for and really think that hotels should offer free in-room internet these days, but on the other hand the parking was plentiful and free. Breakfast was very good - we went for the continental option so cannot comment on the hot food but there was certainly plenty of options available and of good quality. I cannot comment on value for money as our stay was paid for through an agent as part of a larger package.
reviews.title: Good sized room and great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the best part of this hotel, situated away form the smelly side of the lake (the area near the Polynesian spa is significantly smellier) it is also at the base of the main street, leaving an abundance of cafes and restaurants right on your doorstep.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel is as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Abundant parking, clean and resonably well appointed rooms and reasonably priced. $7 water from the minibar however is a bit ridiculous, further so when you consider the 5 star Langley in Auckland has it for $4.
reviews.title: Kapai

description: Novotel Rotorua Lakeside is the leading 4 star hotel located on the shores of Lake Rotorua. The resort features an indoor spa and fitness centre, offering geothermally heated pools, A Cafe, restaurant and bar, Complimentry carparking and a convention centre for up to 500 people. Guests can enjoy nightly performances at our Maori cultural centre, or make the most of nearby attractions, including water activities on the lake and the famous thermal reserves.
